alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 10 at 7:31PM MDT until May 11 at 8:30PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pueblo CO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Colorado... Fountain Creek At Colorado Springs affecting El Paso County. For the Fountain Creek...including Colorado Springs, Fountain Creek near Fountain...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fountain Creek At Colorado Springs. * WHEN...From Thursday morning to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Homeless encampment below and near the Nevada Avenue bridge is affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 5.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 9.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will rise above flood stage to 12.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.1 feet on 07/20/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 800 AM MDT.
